skill.name: ux-audit
skill.description: Perform comprehensive UX audits on pages, components, or features. Use when the user asks to "audit UX", "review usability", "evaluate the interface", "UX review", or wants a systematic evaluation of user experience quality.
skill.summary: Perform comprehensive UX audits on pages, components, or features. Use when the user asks to "audit ...
skill.author: Dami-Randle

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides UX audit guidelines and frameworks. It contains no executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands. The skill is purely instructional and poses no security risks.

content.user_title: Audit user experience with Nielsen's heuristics
content.value_statement: Identify usability issues before users do. Get systematic UX evaluations using proven heuristics to improve interface quality and user satisfaction.
actual_capabilities: Evaluates interfaces against Nielsen's 10 usability heuristics
Assesses visual hierarchy and information architecture
Reviews interaction patterns and user flows
Generates prioritized recommendations with effort estimates
limitations: Requires visual access to the interface being evaluated
Cannot perform actual user testing or behavioral analysis
Recommendations are based on heuristics, not empirical data
Audit quality depends on the completeness of information provided

use_cases.title: Pre-release usability check
use_cases.description: Audit new features before launch to catch critical usability issues and ensure consistent user experience.

use_cases.title: Design iteration review
use_cases.description: Evaluate design iterations against usability standards and identify areas for improvement in mockups or prototypes.

use_cases.title: Code review UX validation
use_cases.description: Review implemented interfaces for usability compliance and ensure designs translate correctly to code.

prompt_templates.title: Basic interface audit
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick evaluation of a single screen
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit the user experience of this login screen: [describe interface or upload screenshot]. Focus on the most critical usability issues.

prompt_templates.title: Feature flow review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the checkout flow from cart to payment confirmation. List each step and identify where users might struggle or abandon the process.

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility + UX audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a UX audit that includes both usability and accessibility considerations for this dashboard interface. Highlight any issues that would affect users with disabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Competitive UX analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit and compare the UX of these three onboarding approaches: [describe each]. Which follows best practices and why? Recommend improvements for each.

output_examples.input: Audit the UX of a mobile banking app transfer feature where users enter amount, select recipient, and confirm
output: Critical Issues: Amount input lacks currency formatting preview
Recommendations: Add real-time amount formatting, show account balance during transfer, provide transfer limit warnings
Positive Patterns: Clear confirmation step with transaction summary, easy recipient selection with recent contacts

best_practices: Provide screenshots or detailed descriptions for accurate audits
Focus on specific user tasks rather than general interface reviews
Include context about your target users and their technical expertise
anti_patterns: Requesting audits without visual reference or clear interface description
Expecting quantitative user data from heuristic evaluation
Using audits as substitute for actual user testing and validation

faq.question: What makes this different from automated UX tools?
faq.answer: This provides human-centered evaluation using established heuristics, catching issues that automated tools miss like cognitive load and user expectations.

faq.question: Can it audit mobile apps and websites?
faq.answer: Yes, it works for any digital interface including mobile apps, web applications, desktop software, and prototypes.

faq.question: How detailed are the recommendations?
faq.answer: Recommendations include specific issues, suggested solutions, implementation effort levels, and priority rankings for systematic improvements.

faq.question: Does it check accessibility compliance?
faq.answer: While it identifies some accessibility issues, use the dedicated accessibility-check skill for WCAG compliance auditing.

faq.question: Can it compare multiple design options?
faq.answer: Yes, provide descriptions or screenshots of different approaches and get comparative analysis with recommendations for each.

faq.question: Is this suitable for early-stage prototypes?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Early audits help identify fundamental issues before investing in detailed design or development work.
